messages.content: Roshan is born. The door opens here, though obviously no memories are comprehensible for a while. They're raised by a pair that could without argument be labelled heretics. Their parents do nothing but harass people with questions all day about the ideas of the church and how evil they find it. They certainly have compelling ideas, but like the people at large Roshan cannot comprehend any of them. You can recall the feelings of them debating you and treating you seriously, feelings of pride about being smarter than others. More mature than others your age. The ideas themselves are incomprehensible to you, but there's an unmistakable attraction to the feeling of agreeing to them. To the idea that you're sharing in a truth too good for the masses. All of this leads into your first solid memory. Your parents are being dragged out of your home by an angry mob chanting "Burn The Heretics!" over and over.

I'm watching them, but I feel like I'm really far away from my body. I know that I'm crying, I know that I'm... inside of our closet, looking out at them through the little cracks. I know that I'm probably really scared, and that that's why I'm shaking so much. But it doesn't feel like me. Instead, it feels like... I'm still over there. Mommy and daddy are patting my head, telling me how clever I am for finding a hiding place so quickly, instead of trying to- instead of trying to help them. Right?
Maybe this is what people mean when they talk about how the soul is different from the body. Maybe those things are happening to my soul.
Either way, 'I' just keep watching.

The mob carry away your parents with increasingly distant chants.

An unfamiliar old man enters the the building with a concerned expression. Someday you’ll know the man as Douglas.

I know he's just here to find more heretics. I cover my mouth with my hand to make the crying softer, but as I move further back into the dark closet, I accidentally hit something with my shoulder, and it falls over, making a noticeable thump. I freeze.
He opens the closet. "Child? Are you alright?"
I start breathing in and out very quickly, and try to run past him to the back of the house.
"Wait!" He attempts to cut you off, opening your path out of the front door.
I don't go that way. I can't go that way. But I suddenly can't make sense of how my house is arranged in my head, so I don't know where to run instead.

I think of what my parents wou- what my parents probably want me to do right now. They always tell me that you have to start conversations from the 'assumption that the other person has the'- um, the, the... the 'burden of proof'. And so, even though I know I look dirty and stupid, and my voice doesn't sound quite right... I turn, shift my eyes up at the man and shakily say - "You doing this to my mom and dad is wr-wrong. And, it's bad to take parents away from their kids. The kind of people who would do that are evil. Even if you don't like them being h-heretics, you should just try to have a conversation with them about it!"
"I haven’t hurt your parents, child. I’m here to help you."
"Are you saying it's actually good to take parents away from their kids? Why do you think that?"
My mouth makes a loud crying noise before I get it under control again and keep staring at him.
"Because… I’m afraid your parents won’t be making it home."
"You didn't answer the question!" I yell.
Douglas sighs. "It’s… *They* may come back for you. It’s best you stay away."

"You didn't answer the question! You didn't answer the question! You're doing, you're distracting from the topic because you know you don't have any logic to b-back you up! Just admit it! If you really believed what you were saying then you would be able to argue in favor of your position instead of avoiding the debate like this!"
Instead of a response, he attempts to give you a hug. This only sets off your panic, however.
"NOOOOO!" I thrash around in his arms, breaking free. "DON'T TAKE ME! DON'T! I'M NOT A HERETIC! I PROMISE! I PROMISE!" I try to run to the back of the house.
You don't do that, because he continues to stand in the way. Your instincts instead carry you out of the open front door as he tries to grab you.

As soon as I realize that I'm outside, I scramble to stop myself. I can't go out there. I can't go after them. I frantically hurry back in, tripping on the front of the doorstep and falling onto my hands and knees. I yelp in pain.
"Please, child... What is your name?" Douglas is trying to follow you. There's no one outside right now. The street is clear.
Weirdly, the pain from the new scrapes on my skin is making me cry less, not more. I feel a little bit less... soul-ish.
I drag myself back up to standing. "U-um... what's YOUR name? Huh?"
"I am Douglas Maudoise. I've recently opened an orphanage in the area. Please, come hide there."

The mention of an orphanage makes me incredibly angry all of a sudden. "Why the f- why the FUCK would I do that, when my parents are alive?!" I automatically feel bad for swearing, but I think it doesn't matter. "We need to help them! I can't just hide! I was already... hiding. I already did that. It didn't work. You're an adult, you should know that- how to save them!" I recite one of the things they always said. "The foundation of a proper human society is believing that other people deserve to be helped, EVEN when they're not a part of your own tribe. Maybe you d-don't get that, since you're one of those... people."
"Everyone has gathered in front of the church, child. Nothing can be done." You know where in front of the church is, at least.
((is it intentional that he knows my name when I haven't said it yet))
((No I'm dumb))
"What do you mean nothing can be done?! Just go there and get them! Ahhhh!"
I try to make myself run outside, so maybe he'll follow. But I can't get my body to do what I want. I guess the scrapes weren't enough.

My anger is suddenly gone. I'm just scared again. Nothing but scared. "Please. Please, just help them. I'll do anything, I'll go to the orphanage. Just let them live." I grab my hands together as I beg.
He looks conflicted. "Do... You want to see why I can't?"
"I... yes?" I can try to... make it go away. The reason.
He lifts you up and carries you over his shoulder.
I lay across it limply.

You reach a massive crowd of people surrounding a smaller stage. The stage has 2 large wooden poles, with your parents bound to them. The Holy Maiden is leading the people in a prayer for your parent's souls. You can see a few churchpeople standing behind the stage, including 2 children. They are of course Daryush and his sister, though that fact won't be apparent for years to come. "This city is united, child."
As soon as I see them, I tense my body and start screaming over the noise of the crowd, pleading with some force of the universe for them to be able to hear. "MOMMY!! DADDY!! NO!!!"
"DOUGLAS, YOU HAVE TO GET THEM DOWN!" I beat on his shoulder with my small fists.
Attention turns towards you and the old man. "Child, shush..." He puts you down. "Very well, I shall try something. Just... Don't bring attention to yourself."
"WHY?! WHATEVER YOU'RE GOING TO DO, JUST DO IT! SAVE THEM!" I'm still screaming.

The Maiden steps off the stage and approaches you, causing the crowd to part ways for her. "Are you the Ghahremani child?"

"Because of that." Douglas.
I gasp. "N-no! I'm- I-" I grab Douglas' hand. "Th-this man is my father. So I c-can't be."
My body quivers with my voice.

"Yes, ind-" Douglas is silenced as an invisible hand grabs his throat and pulls him away from you. 

"A wise choice, child." The maiden kneels down to your level with an empty expression.
"I- I- I-" I can't get any words to come out. I just stare into her eyes, mouth open.

"Rejoice, child. Your lineage is about to be cleansed. You shall bear the honor of clean blood. The right to exist under the blessing of our goddess. What say you?" She gives you an oppressive feeling hug.

I wish so badly that mom and dad were standing next to me, telling her why she's making the world a worse place. Why she's in the wrong for thinking herself blessed, while others must be unblessed; for taking ownership of these people's lives under false pretenses; for violating my personal boundaries. Whatever other smart-sounding things they would say. But they're up there, and I have to stand down here in their place. Right?
And so, I try to force myself to speak. But all that comes out is a single, shaky word. "Please..."
Please don't. Please stop. Please, do anything but this. I don't know. All I really know how to do is beg. Please.

"Followers of the goddess... Start the bonfires." She speaks with a hollow voice.

You watch as 2 priests set the poles alight. Your parents scream in agony as- No, that's not right. That's not what you see when you look back, is it? It may be out of order, but I'll include the truth.

You are with Daryush, at the time of your sin. The mob you control chants "Burn the heretics." as they tear down the church. You watch someone set it alight with a smug expression as you continue your poetry. 2 priests run out, robes aflame and you watch the life fade away in smoke. That is what you see when you think of this moment. The Maiden can't force you to see anything. You win at least this much. 

"It's over. Don't you feel cleansed?" She gives the same sort of empty smile. She can't seem to feel anything. Why should she deserve to make you feel anything?

The words leave your mouth before you have a chance to process them. "I don't care. I don't know who those people are."

Real emotion finally rises to her face as she frowns.
I let my voice continue. "Did you think I was lying? My name is Roshan Maudoise."

She stands up with an indignant expression. You can see the neurons in her head firing and failing to come up with a justification to publicly be mad at you. She simply whispers to you. "This church is about justice. Without fail, anyone who comes into contact with it will get what they deserve. Remember that." She walks away.

Someday, you might even believe she’s right since she ended up dead and buried before you even had to lift a finger. Maybe karma is real sometimes. 

Douglas returns to you.
I don't bother asking if his neck is okay. "Let's go. Back to the orphanage."
He nods, bringing you there. No one is around right now. The few older kids leave you alone. "Are you hungry, Roshan?"
"No." I'm not. "Is it okay if I just sleep?"
"Yes. There’s still a bed free. I’m sorry, Roshan. Sometimes these things happen."

I ignore the second half of his response, and walk over to the open bed. As I slowly, carefully lift myself onto it, and pull the covers over my head, I think about how empty of thoughts my brain is. And then, I think about the way that thought makes itself wrong. And then - I fall asleep.

You dream of a candle. It's burning defiantly. Boldly. Maybe that candle is you. You don't like that. You blow it out. 

You don't care what anyone says. Fire is the enemy of life. You're a smart kid, so you're sure of that. Fire can only hurt people and take things away. You're not 'scared', how could you be? Your aversion to fire is built on logic and reason. The people who are going to be afraid are the people *you're* going to burn some day. You have developed the ability to put out any fire you can see unobstructed, and the frequent impulse to do so. They're dangerous, after all.

Time passes until your memories rejoin the door of growth.

"Thus ends your retribution for being the Peerless Poet." The door speaks.

You and Douglas are kicked out into an unfamiliar room built like a jail cell. Metal bars surround you, and The Wolf's hand shuts the cell door behind you 2. The next moment, he makes the retribution door disappear, giving you a full view of the bizarre cavern. There's blood everywhere, and you see piles of corpses that look kind of like... Art pieces? In 1 corner is the Corruption Door, a disgusting door covered in poisonous looking greenery. The door part practically looks like a mouth ready to consume you. In the opposite corner is a passageway that presumably leads to outside. In the center of the room is a cooking fire with the leg you thought Johammad was eating being turned around like meat on a skewer.

"Welcome baaaaaack." The Wolf.

I failed, then... didn't I? I couldn't bring any of myself into that door. It was just... *them.* Roshan Maudoise, or Ghahremani, or the Poet. All my mental squabbling, for nothing. I was erased in an instant, just like all the other times. Shoved into that body and carried along for the ride. Made to care about the things they cared about. And no matter how deluded I try to be, I'm not sure I can convince myself to stop caring again this time.
I look out at the art gallery. It's disgusting, but in a way that leaves me with nowhere for that disgust to go. I'm not numb, really. Just...
I don't know.
"Did you set this up?"
"It looks... like it took a lot of effort."

"Aww... You noticed! I'm honored. When it comes to art... Some might say I'm still an amateur. But I think this is beautiful no matter what they say. There's so much beauty in the lifeless form, don't you think?" The Wolf.

"Stay back, Roshan. He could attack again." Douglas takes out his quarterstaff.
"No, I think if he wanted to attack us he wouldn't have put us inside of a cage, Doug."
I poke at the visible metal bars. "It protects us just as much as him, really. Haha."

The bars are visible and made of metal.

"All in due time... I've gotta go torture the wolfman a bit before it's time for him to watch you two die!" The Wolf starts walking away. "Have fun in there! I do love me some family bonding time!" 

"..." Douglas grimaces.
((what did you mean by 'he shuts the cell door and then makes the door disappear'))
((Retribution door. I've edited to clarify))
O-okay, I really need to come up with a way to help Jo. I don't want to stand by while he gets tortured... um...
"Wait!" I yell out at The Wolf, hoping if he turns around I can think of some interesting topic to delay with.

"Nice try. I'm sure he'll appreciate your desperation in your final screams! But he's waiting for me. It'd be rude to keep him waiting." The Wolf leaves.

((end session))
"Nice try. I'm sure he'll appreciate your desperation in your final screams! But he's waiting for me. It'd be rude to keep him waiting." The Wolf leaves.
Shit. Shit! I can't even spare him a single second of pain like this. What am I doing?
I shake my head. "Douglas, we need to get out of here."
"Indeed we do. Do you have any ideas?"
"Oh, uh... no, I don't think so. Maybe if the cage was made of fire, I could do something. Haha." I smile weakly, then immediately correct myself and frown.
"Setting aside everything else, you're the one who knows magic, aren't you? You were trying to do some earlier."
"What? No, I know no such thing. I am a pure follower of the gods. The real gods, of course."
"Is that just a cane, then? I thought... it was a magical staff, to be honest."
"You seemed like the type."
"Good. Alright. That's okay. Um."
I start pacing around the cage nervously.
This is going to sound stupid, but how wide are the gaps between the bars?
You can fit your arm through, but not the rest of your body.
Does the door lock with a normal key?
((Roll investigation))
You easily find the door's lock by feeling around the door area. It does seem like a pretty normal key.
"Ah... can you help me look around for something to pick it with?"
I look around for something to pick it with.
There is unfortunately nothing in the cage itself except for you 2.
"Do you have anything on you besides that staff?"
"I have the clothes on my back." He speaks smugly.
"I- what?" Why is he taking that tone?
It doesn't really... matter. "Do you think either of us is strong enough to shatter your staff? Maybe... a piece of wood from it might... I don't know. Something." I mutter.
"Y-you're not really doing anything. At least I'm actually trying."
"Don't look down on me for that."
"I apologize. It was merely a gag."
"Well, can you suggest something anyways?"
"Hmm… I suppose my first question is where are we? Have you ever seen somewhere like this on the island? I certainly haven’t."
"I don't understand what you mean. We're just on the other side of that door from earlier, right? That is..." I look around to make sure we're still in something recognizable as a cave of some sort.

You are indeed in a cave but it’s definitely not the one from earlier. This is a completely different room.

"No, he moved the door again. That was his trap." Douglas.
"How would you know? Were you already familiar with the cave's layout somehow? This could very easily just be adjacent to the room we were in before."
"The material of the walls has changed, and no one had spotted the corruption door until now."
"What do you mean by that? No one had spotted it? Why would they have?"
"I- ugh. Doesn't matter."
His clothing doesn't have any zippers or buttons on it, right?
"Because the corruption door is right there?" He points at it.
"We're in a cave nobody has been in before!"
"Then the question is… Where is it? Can the others hear us if we’re loud enough?"
"Do... do you want me to start yelling?"
"You’ve always been good at projecting your voice, haven’t you?"
I flush. "That wasn't- I, um. Caves don't really have the same acoustics as stages do. Why don't you give it a shot first?"
"I suppose I could, hoho…"
I cover my ears in anticipation.
He shouts as instructed.
"If that got a response, I certainly didn’t hear it."
Frustrated, I cover my ears again and start yelling as well.
((What are you yelling? Just a general scream?))
Yes. Same as him, I assume.
No response?
None.
"Wow! Great idea."

"I apologize, I suppose." Douglas.

Cyrus enters the room.
"Um- hello!"
“Aaaa…” Am I still in the same place? Are the others still here and asleep?
Yes.
"I, um... sorry to wake you up, if you were enjoying your nap! I just figured... you know, I saw you go through the door in the village, I'm pretty sure! And that's a ways away from here."

“Oh. Right, there’s like… someone set up a violent death threat against you, I think? Veneration, or whatever.” I rub my eyes. “So we… Cyrus figured better to not have you be off on your own.” I try to shake Cyrus awake.
"O... oh. Well... not like I'm not used to that! I actually learned I was assaulted several times as a child in this door back here, haha. Not particularly pleasant stuff."
Cyrus is shooken awake.
"Well, good morning!"
I mumble in my unconsciousness. "Why would you even say that, fathe- guh." I am woken up. "Shit, where's- where did L go?"
"Was he sleeping with you here?"

"Wha- no, he was just- he showed up here, he went to Yazmine, and. He grabbed a sword that appeared on your gear. Out of nowhere. And then when I tried to confront him about it, I- I got knocked out? No, wait, I- I tripped. Urgh... but- but the way he looked at me when I did, it's almost like he knew that would happen. Why does this keep happening...?"

"...Oh. Well that's somewhat freaky. I figured he would've just left to do whatever it is that he does after leading me here. Um... I'm hearing something about a death threat leveled at me? That seems awfully inconvenient. I get it, of course, I just... thought most of everyone came to a neutral or better conclusion on the whole man-eating beast manner."
"It's just- ah, yes. Your thing- a venator threat, specifically performed against a wolf. No denial on what that could mean."
"Like... an anonymous threat?"
"No, uh. Venators." I explain what venators are according to this.
“Wait, he took my sword??”
"...Huh." I blink. "That... must've been one of the wolves I slept alongside on my first night here."
"Yes, an- an invisible sword that was in your stuff."
"Ah. I'm... sorry to hear, Jo."
"It's... it's alright, I think? Poor thing. Seems like there's a lot we'll need to look out for."
"At any rate, where's Fours?"
“That was my dad’s… I got it in a dream for killing him, or something.”
“Oh, not Douglas, though. Don’t think I killed him. I have two dads.”
“No mom, as far as I know.” I click my tongue. “Whaddaya gonna do.”

"I... haven't seen Fours. Did he not go into the door with you?" 

I start to think over what Yazmine said, though. "Ok... well... huh. Ok, wait. So... L is definitely doing *something* shady, but- why does he need the sword? How did he knock me out, and- agh, my head hurts..." I put my fingers to my temples. "Just- alright, with that, and the weird Ismalisa thing, there's definitely something up with the whole challenge. We gotta figure it out."
"...I went through this door alone, after the one in the village told me I couldn't go through without my dad, who refused to go along with me. Are they still back there?"
"Ebrahim? Yeah, he- he and I had a talk. He... does not want to help us get out. He thinks it's pointless, because he knows how it ends."
"...I meant Fours, more so. Are they still in memory-land past the door?"
"Maybe, yeah. I haven't seen him in the village or in here."
"I think I'll go back there, then, if that's alright."
"...I don't think you should go unaccompanied. I'm worried for your safety."

"I... I suppose." But at the same time, it would feel very nice to be able to, wouldn't it?

"If you all fell asleep here just to keep watch on me, then perhaps we could wake the rest up and make the trek back."
"Of course, yes. I'll go wake up the other two." And I do just that.
((End session))
Azura is shaken awake.
"Awawa..." I say.
"G… good morning."
"Hello. Come on, we've got to go."
"Eh?"
"Johammad wants to go to the village, and it'd be a bad idea to split up or let him go alone. We should go with him."
"Alright."
"Back to the village already? Okay." Daryush.
"Yeah. I guess I’m the only one who had the chance to go through this door. But that’s alright! You all made it through the maze once, so I’m sure you can do it again."
"...Yeah."
"Anyone know how to solve the maze the other way around or shall we just hope?" Daryush.
"If it changes daily, the original path me and Yazmine used should still be there, and we'd be able to go through it again easily enough."
"Well, lead the way."
I do just that.
I follow!
Cyrus does not in fact know the way. ((Roll investigation))
((Mama mia.))
((Surely this will work.))
You all successfully make it out of the maze and end up back outside.
My hubris goes unpunished once more. "Here we are."
"Back to the village then." Daryush heads in that direction.
I go there too.
yea ok
I follow and all that.
59 is in the village.
As I look around and spot nobody nearby, I take some time to reflect on what I had just seen. After a bit, I reconfirm for myself that I can still feel the magic flowing through my veins.
It’s nighttime at this point. You can indeed still cast magic.
Given the late time, I decide I'm better off trying to return to the cabin I slept in the prior evening, that belonging to the man I know as my father.

You’re not feeling tired since you spent so much of the day in the door.

"You’ll do… Nicely." An ominous voice speaks from someone nearby.
My head swivels around towards the voice, trying to spot them. I immediately go to prepare my magic.

You can make out the outline of a hooded figure in the shadow. "Hahahaha! Don’t bother, girl. You can’t take me. Even your precious father wasn’t an issue for me." He lets out a mad cackle. "I’ve just got a message for you. Pass it along, kay?"
"What did you do with him?" I ask, still ready to cast if I think the situation calls for it.

"That’s what I’m getting to. Jeez… You’re like my little sister, hehe. Are all women such nags? I’ve got him and 64 locked up where you’ll never find them. Send the wolf man up to the top of the mountain at dawn or I’ll kill them. And… I’ll kill anyone you send with him. So feel free to give me a little offering with him if you’re insistent, hahahaha! It gets boring stalking in the dark."

"Damnit!" I let out a scream of frustration. If this guy's got Fours too, then I need to figure out some sort of way to pull this off and save everyone. "Alright, I'll accept your stupid deal. Where's Johammad?"
"Hahahahaha! You even named that guy!? He’s an animal! You gonna start calling me a human name too? Idiot." He fades away into the darkness.

"Fucking pissant." I scoff, and begin a search of the huts near the beach, the town where we first met people in Sinspace. Given this is where I last saw Johammad, it seems as reasonable a space as ever to begin my search.
No one is around.
I decide to check the cabin where I slept last night. Even if I'm not tired I should see if I can find anyone there to help me out.
34, 56, 57, 60, and 63 all enter the village.
"Roshan’s still missing?" Daryush.
I open my mouth to speak, but decide to shut it for a moment longer, waiting for everyone else to speak first.
"Um… hello, Ruthilla. Surely Fours is just still in the door? Or- or have you seen them?"

I guess that I'm probably the one with the most information at this point, given nobody else really responds.

"No, they aren't. I... someone said that they had Father and Fours both kidnapped. They want us to send you up the mountain alone, or else they'll kill Fours and Father both. Same deal if we send anyone with you."
“What?! What do you mean someone?”
"...ah. So I was right to worry."
"What!? Who?" 34.
"Oh, haha. What?" I think I’m getting light-headed. Or nauseous? I don’t really know how to describe this.
"What… Did you say?" 01 stumbles into the village with a horrified expression.
I sit on the ground, clutching my head. This doesn’t feel real.
"Well, process of elimination seems to indicate L did this, right? Hells..."

"Someone said that they had Father and Fours both kidnapped. They want us to send Johammad up the mountain alone, or else they'll kill Fours and Father both. Same deal if we send anyone with Johammad."
"Why… why me… why do they have to…"
"It has to do with that thing, right? The… ritual sacrifice… the hunter thing…"
01 grabs onto Ruthilla’s shoulders with a crazed expression. "What was he wearing? What did he look like!?"

"I don't *know* why!" I burst out. Taking a deep breath to steady my nerves, I speak more calmly. "But, it seems illogical for us to send you alone. The figure, they said... they said Fours and Father were somewhere we'd never find."

Looking at 01, I forcefully pull my shoulders away from his grip. "He was in the shadows! I have no idea!"
((sorry here))
I bite my nail, swearing. "Fuck. It probably was L, the bastard. I hate him, I hate him, I..."

"Why am I being singled out…? What did I ever…"

I don’t have it in me to cry again. I guess I’m glad about that? I don’t know. I don’t know… maybe I just can’t cry until it’s over? Maybe this is a test. Of my resolve.

"L sucks but... We can just take him, right? What's the threat? He's never seemed like a powerful fighter." Daryush.

01 backs away from Ruthilla, clutching his head. "It's him... He's back... Why? What did...?"
"I didn't want to test taking him on alone." I avert my eyes from the group. "It's been a long time since I've used my magic in any real way. I don't know what I can do with it."
I breathe in. I breathe out. I breathe in. I breathe out… I breathe in… I breathe… out… oh, God…
"Hey, don't..." I say anxiously to Johammad. *Oh hell, don't have a panic attack or something. I don't think I could handle that.*
"We have to do something. We can't let that prick kill both of them. We're not letting him kill Johammad, either."

…

I jump!!! To my feet!!! "I know what’s going on here!" I shout loudly and boomingly and… some other synonym for that, I don’t know, I just! Need! Everyone’s! Attention!
Daryush focuses on 01. "Chief-? Huh?" He turns back at Johammad's announcement.
"Huh?"

"This is… a test! I don’t know of the kidnapper meant it that way, or anything, but… you know what this is? This is like one of those old books! A damsel in distress sort of situation! We’re past bad omens, and into bad happenings, so… if anything, this is like a trial for me!"
"A trial... of faith?"
"What good am I as a protector if I can’t even…"
"A- a trial! Of *me*!!!"

"Well... I mean, maybe metaphorically? But the literally feels like the way bigger question here." Daryush. 

"Mohammad, you can't... You can't take him... None of you can..." 01.
“…”  I look deep in thought for a bit. “…I can.”
"Ebrahim, if there ever was a time for you to elaborate, *now* is that time."
"01. Talk."
"It's... Inmate 0. We called him... The wolf..." He passes out and collapses to the ground.

"It’s not really a matter of if I *can*, and more so what I *have to* do. I- I mean, I already made it a problem for Fours and the old guy, right? If I got anyone more involved, I would- I’d be a pretty bad protecto-… oh." I look at my dad’s collapsed body and shut up.
"Oh, for god's-" I pinch my brow. "Could he have been any less specific after we asked for more details?"
“Oh there’s an inmate zero.” Zero is less than one. That makes sense. Maybe? Not really.
"…Maybe he’s just jealous of there being more than one wolf around here?" I smile.

"Chief? What the hell!?" Daryush shakes him to no avail.

Ismalisa materializes. "At last. 60 and 59 have appeared together. Do you both feel closer to atonement after your doors?"
“Isma, is there an inmate 0? Is that a thing?”
"Um… no!" I clear my throat. "Not really, if I’m to be perfectly honest."
I jump again. "Fuckin-"

A few days later, you hear a knock at your door.

The Cyrus Eskinder enters your home. You don’t know who that is.

*"You do not. But I know you. Criminal fugitive of the Ardelunian Empire. What is it that you've done, again...?"*
My face turns stony. Indifferent. "Murder of their prized assassins, I assume is the charge?"

*"Ah, I see. The charge was simply murder. But that explains their outrage at the fact they could not find you."

I stand next to her bed. "Why take refuge in the Zetrumian City, Miss Maudoise?"*
The answer is both simple and complex. You find it best to simply limit it to knowing an old acquaintance here.
"I... had an old acquaintance. I wanted to say goodbye, knowing my time was coming to an end. After all, you'd find me no matter what, wouldn't you?"
*"...I believe there's a miscommunication here, Miss Maudoise. I am not an Ardelunian. I am the defacto leader of the Zetrumian City."*

*"Because the Ardelunian Empire has been creating chaos and unrest in **my**- in the city I run. Due to your presence within it."*
"And you seek to turn me over, do you not? Save your citizens in exchange for casting out a refugee?" I snicker. "I suppose I do not blame you for such a thought."
*"...I am unsure, for now. I am many things. But I am not a man that will be taking this flagrant disrespect of my city as a method to **kneel**. "*
*"Are you sure you'll die no matter what?"*
"They'll find a way to me. Whether it's in your city or out of it. Had I the strength any longer, I would have left of my own accord at this point."
*"As you reside here, you are a resident of my city. And while I hold the title of leader, I will make sure all my citizens will have a good life."*

*I pull out an ornate dagger. A reminder of my duties as leader.*

I stare down the dagger. Watching as the small amount of light in the room glistens on the embedded jewels of the hilt, I take a moment to myself, then speak once more. "I suppose, in that case, I have my answer."
*"Speak."*
"End my life, here and now. Do not give them the satisfaction of claiming it for themselves."
